fields.description: I have a wide monitor and I keep my firefox windows wide.  When I go to bamboo, there is soooo much horizontal space between the build plan name and the "do it" button that I often start the wrong build.  If the "go" button is instead close to the plan name, it would be much easier to choose the right build.
fields.summary: Move start/stop buttons closer to build plan names

fields.description:
1. When configuration (Dependencies) is not in edit mode then Dependency is shown
2. After entering edit mode it disappears.

example: https://gdansk.bamboo2.atlassian.com/build/admin/edit/editBuildConfiguration.action?buildKey=INT-DPL

What is necessary for me is to disable building plan (even it depends on other) from building automatically
fields.summary: Dependency build is not visible when editing configuration in Dependencies tab

fields.description: In one of our projects, we can run only one build per time, we have 10 builds and they all have build strategy "Single Daily Build ". It would be nice if we could see build strategies for all builds at one place.
fields.summary: View with expected start of schaduled builds per project

Merge plan and chains are the same spike to chains branch

for produced artifacts traverse all plans and for those plans the require a new produced artifact then add a 'link', for plans that require a removed artifact then remove the link.

update for import/export.
ui - dependency page. generated dependencies are not editable and cannot be deleted.
upgrade task
db change - this means a new intermediate object.
Check and make the maven tab work on multi module projects.
On the maven tab resolve artifacts to plans so the user can see what plans a given artifacts relates to.  Make the artifact name a link to the resolved plan.

support bulk manual build.

admins can turn the maven dependency feature on/off per plan.
generated dependencies are created after builds complete based on maven dependency info.

Show the snapshot dependencies at the top of the maven tab, ie update the maven dependency parser so that it can just provide snapshot dependencies.
Re-enable the maven tab to see if it still works on single module projects.

fields.description: Seems to be a lot of deprecated API's in Bamboos source code. Would be excellent to clean this up for 3.0.
fields.summary: Remove deprecated API's

fields.description:
When a build goes very badly wrong, Bamboo sometimes copies a previous build's test artifacts and reports test failures from that build.  This is somewhat understandable.

Unfortunately, the Build Summary displays the Test Failures before the Error Summary, so it's easy to completely miss the fact that the build failed to run at all, and go trying to figure out why those tests are failing again.

Please move the Error Summary to before the Tests so that such confusion is less likely.
fields.summary: Build summary should show errors before test failures
cannot start 2 remote agents as a service on windows

fields.description: Remove use of backport-util-concurrent in favour of java.util.concurrent now that we use JAVA 5
fields.summary: Remove use of backport-util-concurrent in favour of java.util.concurrent

fields.description:
*Suggestion:*
Add  a hint about OAuth into the information message that appears in a gadget when the OAuth consumer has not been set up.

*Explanation:*
When adding the 'Bamboo Status' and 'Bamboo Plan Summary' gadgets, you get a very pretty blue message on the gadget saying {{The website (container) you have placed this gadget on is unauthorised. Please contact your system administator to have it approved}}. That is a good and user-friendly message, but it doesn't give any helpful information about what sort of approval is required. What actually has to happen is that the Bamboo administrator has to add JIRA as an OAuth consumer in Bamboo. I know that '*OAuth*' is a horribly technical term, but I still think we should include it in the message as a hint to administrators that this is what is required. The Bamboo and JIRA admin screens do talk about OAuth, and so do our docs.

*Current message wording:*
{quote}The website (container) you have placed this gadget on is unauthorised. Please contact your system administator to have it approved.{quote}

*Suggested wording:*
{quote}The website (container) you have placed this gadget on is unauthorised. Please contact your system administrator to have the websie added as an OAuth consumer.{quote}

*Spelling problem:*
BTW, I think the word "administrator" may be misspelled in the original text too. :)

*Is this message standard across gadgets?*
I'm not sure where to put this issue report. Is the above text held as a standard across all gadgets? Perhaps the text is produced by an OAuth plugin?
fields.summary: Gadget info box should include 'OAuth' hint when OAuth authorisation required

fields.description:
There are no options currently to have behavior differ based on "svn up"'s return code. When a build changes the source tree itself (which may happen due to busted tests, or bizarre components like ASPNETCOMPILER), a future source control update may resolve in a conflict. It would be good to fail the build when this happens so the cause can be investigated.

We could use "force clean build", but this would mask problems in the build that may need investigating, and would also dramatically increase build time for our source tree, which is a couple of gigabytes in size.
fields.summary: Subversion checkout module should fail build if conflict is detected during svn update
Faster Setup: Visual indication for long running tasks in Setup Wizard

fields.description:
moving a plan from project A to project B does not rename the build log files.

./xml-data/builds/A-HEAD/download-data/build_logs/A-HEAD-1.log

is moved to

./xml-data/builds/B-HEAD/download-data/build_logs/*A*-HEAD-1.log

the UI tries to link to download/B-HEAD/build_logs/B-HEAD-1.log

and throws an exception.
fields.summary: moving plans across projects does not rename log files (artifacts).

fields.description:
The clover coverage chart would be more useful if you could mouse over to get the build number at a specific data point
and also click through to a specific build.
fields.summary: Clover chart should be per-build, and link through to the build

fields.description: If one is already set, it seems to ignore it
fields.summary: Updating repository polling time doesn't work

fields.description:
Please add a long text field at the plan level in which a detailed description of the plan can be added.  This could also be occasionally used to describe the state of the plan.

Here's my use-case. Various builds in our project have ridiculously detailed names.  I'd love to shorten them to make them more readable.  I'd move some of the details to the plan's "description" field but there isn't one. 

To work around this I'm probably going to have to put the information into a wiki page.
fields.summary: Add a "description" field for plans
Clover 1-Click integration for Ant is broken on Windows

fields.description:
We currently do not specify the exact environment variables that Bamboo looks for when detecting a builder. This is useful information for an admin, if Bamboo is not detecting a builder correctly.

Need some dev help to find out what the variables are.
fields.summary: Document specific environment variables required for Bamboo to detect each of the builders supported

fields.description:
There is no way to edit a global variable, you are forced to Delete it, then Add it again.

If nothing else, this leaves a small window where the variable is NOT defined, plus introduces the possibility that you misspell the variable name when you go to re-add it.
fields.summary: There is no way to edit a Global Variable (only Add/Delete)

fields.description: For great justice.
fields.summary: Move SAL implementation into Bamboo

fields.description:
Recently a timing issue between agent and server caused a timeout during agent registration.
A message should be displayed in the UI
fields.summary: agent timing issues should be reported in more detail via the UI

fields.description:
Our project currently uses Maven, Bamboo and Sonar.
We noticed a difference between the test counts reported by Bamboo and Sonar.

Bamboo seems to count ignored tests (@Ignore annotation) while Sonar excludes ignore tests. For example we have a build plan that shows 109 tests executed in Bamboo while Sonar show 106 tests executed and 3 ignored.

This is very confusing to our development community. It would be better if Bamboo showed total tests, executed tests and ignored tests.
fields.summary: Bamboo is counting ignored JUnit tests.

fields.description: Validation is needed for successful/failed PHPUnit runs on Linux/Windows environment. Unit tests or functional tests needed.
fields.summary: Investigate if PHPUnit builder result code can be used as the only input to decide if build had succeded.

fields.description: Getting method not found exceptions in the bamboo-sal plugin.  I *think* it just needs a rebuild and re-release.  No code changes required.

fields.description:
the problem is that the build execution output grew when other plugins are added.

009-09-13 01:03:56,970 INFO [BAM::Default Agent::Agent:pool-4-thread-1] [PhpUnitBuilder] Build failed since text 'OK' was not found in the last 20 lines of the output.

So even though 'OK' appears it's not in the last 20 lines - we should increase it to say 200...

In PhpUnitBuilder we should use a system property.
private static final int PHPUNIT_FIND_SUCCESS_MESSAGE_IN_LAST = <System.property>;
accordingly.
fields.summary: phpunit builder should (optionally) only check for a return code or make the number of lines for 'OK' message flexible

fields.summary: Removing plans from stages does not delete associated objects

fields.description: Our application will sometimes hang in testing when a component is down. Logging continues, though. As logging continues the build hang detection does not kick in. Setting this value to 0 would indicate 'ignore incoming logs' and base the build hanging trigger decision purely on build time.
fields.summary: Build hanging detection to allow a build time only condition
